definition[0]: to go into a quiet or less active state
example[0]: He lapsed into a coma and died two days later.
definition[1]: to begin to behave or speak in a way that you did before
example[2]: She lapsed back into her old ways.
example[3]: Occasionally he lapsed into his native German.
definition[2]: to get into a worse state or become worse
example[4]: Following his death, the Empire lapsed into chaos.
example[5]: His poetry often lapses into sentimentality.
definition[3]: to begin to be in a bad state
example[6]: The economy lapsed deeper into recession.
example[7]: The stock market lapsed into a broad decline today.
